traits.appointment_among_seven: Chosen as one of the seven men full of the Spirit and wisdom appointed to oversee the distribution to widows in the Jerusalem community.
traits.full_of_grace_and_power: Described as full of grace and power, performing great wonders and signs among the people.
traits.dispute_and_arrest: Engages in debate with members of various synagogues; when they cannot withstand his wisdom and Spirit, they bring false accusations about his words against the temple and the law.
traits.speech_before_council: Delivers a lengthy speech rehearsing Israel’s history, emphasizing God’s presence beyond the temple and critiquing resistance to the Holy Spirit.
traits.vision_and_martyrdom: Sees the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at God’s right hand; is stoned outside the city while praying for his executioners’ forgiveness, becoming the first Christian martyr.
traits.impact_on_mission: His death triggers great persecution in Jerusalem that scatters believers and leads to wider mission beyond the city; Saul consents to his killing and begins persecuting the church.
